item.title: NYS DOT Tabling to be held on February 24

item.description: The Economics department will be holding info sessions to discuss the (co-term) MS in Economics program. Join us virtually February 26 from 11am-12pm. item.title: How to Stay Involved with RPI as an Alum
item.description: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join our info session to learn how to stay involved as an alum. You will learn about the Office of Alumni Engagement, how to be an alumnus, alumni benefits, athletics & affinity groups, post graduation checklist, and more!
item.author: Students

item.title: Countdown to Commencement Celebration - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 11:00 AM - 5:00 PM - The Countdown to Commencement celebrates graduating students and prepares them for commencement and their transition into becoming alumni of Rensselaer. Attendees will be able to learn important information about commencement, purchase their cap and gown, learn about end-of-semester events, and much more. The event is open to all students graduating in May 2025.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Hosts Mechanical Engineering Review - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work faculty for a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Register online here.

item.title: C&M Colloquium Scheduled for February 19
item.description: Please join the Communication and Media Department for a seminar titled “Suspended Lives: Cryonics and Cultural Techniques of the Undead” from Dr. Ethan Stoneman, Associate Professor and Chair of Rhetoric and Media at Hillsdale College. The event starts at 2pm in Sage 4711.

item.title: BSA Fashion Show
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 6:00 pm - This year, the RPI Black Students’ Alliance Fashion Show is presented in partnership with EMPAC Research and PULSE, the RPI student group exploring electronic dance music. In a world overflowing with fast-fashion, this show asks, How can experimental and multisensory media drive progress toward eco-futurism? Student visions merge with custom couture and bleeding-edge research to showcase our collective creativity. Presented by EMPAC Research Performance

item.title: Western Digital - HDD Teardown workshop to be held Feb. 27 between 4-5PM
item.description: On Thurs., Feb. 27th from 4-5pm, Western Digital will be hosting their HDD Teardown workshop. This workshop gives attendees the opportunity to learn about the cloud through a hands-on workshop related to data storage. Learn more and register in Handshake—space is limited! item.title: Mercer X Staff Hours and Staff Skills Schedule
item.description: The Spring 2025 Mercer XLab is open 8 a.m.- 8 p.m. on weekdays. The Mercer XLab Staff schedule includes the names with their associated skills to help you during work hours. Visit https://mercerxlab.rpi.edu/lab-access-and-resources and click on “Spring 2025 Schedule (Created by Notion)” to find the staff with the skills you need to help you succeed!

item.title: Mercer X February Clubhouse Workshops and Seminars
item.description: Mercer X Affiliated Clubs are offering workshops for any RPI student in February! Upcoming workshops include: Introduction to Siemens NX CAD Workshop (2/15), Soldering and HF Antenna Build (2/19), and Data Structure Review Session (2/26). Microelectronics Packaging Seminars are every Thursday. All are held in JEC 6203/6204 and hosted by the Rensselaer Spaceflight Society, Embedded Hardware Club, W2SZ Radio Club, Girls Who Code, and IEEE EPS! Contact sawyes@rpi.edu to receive more information.

item.title: STS Colloquium scheduled for February 19
item.description: Join us on February 19 at 11:30am in Sage 5711 for a STS Colloquium with Kristen Reynolds: “Excavating the (hu)Man in the Machine: Speculating Beyond Today’s Engineering Imaginary”. Kristen’s research utilizes Black speculative literature and culture to interrogate how engineering imaginaries reproduce antiblackness through their coherence around Sylvia Wynter’s articulation of “Man2, overrepresented as the human.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: Supervisory Essentials
item.description: In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Important Notice: NY Paid Prenatal Leave
item.description: Managers and supervisors are encouraged to attend a webinar on Thursday, February 20th at 11:00 am to learn about NY Paid Prenatal Leave. Under this policy, employees who are pregnant or trying to become pregnant receive an additional 20 hours of paid leave for prenatal medical care.

item.title: Spring Lunch and Learn Series: Helping Students Learn
item.description: Faculty are invited to a spring Lunch and Learn Series on Helping Students Learn. This is a 3-part series on research-based teaching theories and methods. The first session will be on February 26 with a focus on Accessing Prior Knowledge—Preparing Students to Learn New Material. Registration is limited.
